# prime_image_maker
make a prime number looks like an image

# Required

* openssl
* python 3
* cv2 module of python
* numpy

This python program use openssl command through system call.

# Tested environment

* WSL (Ubuntu 18.04.3)
* openssl: OpenSSL 1.1.1  11 Sep 2018
* python: 3.6.8
* OpenCV: 4.1.1
* Numpy: 1.17.2

# Usage

```
 prime.py [-W WIDTH] [-H HEIGHT] [-N NUM_COLOR] [-q] filename
```

When the input filename is xxxx, prime\_xxxx will be created.

# Example

* sage-git.png

![original image](https://github.com/sage-git/prime_image_maker/blob/master/img/sage-git.png)


* Command

```
python3 prime.py -W 29 -N 2 sage-git.png
```

* Standard output

```
checking (0, 1)
checking (0, 3)
checking (0, 7)
checking (0, 9)
checking (1, 3)
checking (1, 7)
found good permutation
----

----
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
77111117777777777777771111177
77111117777777777777771111177
77111117777777777777771111177
77111117777777777777771111177
77111117777777777777771111177
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
77111111111111111111111111177
77111111111111111111111111177
77111111111111111111111111177
77111111111111111111111111177
77111111111111111111111111177
77111117777711111777771111177
77111117777711111777771111177
77111117777711111777771111177
77111117777711111777771111177
77111117777711111777771111177
77111111111177777111111111177
77111111111177777111111111177
77111111111177777111111111177
77111111111177777111111111177
77111111111177777111111111177
77777777777777777777777777777
77777777777777777777777777777
Avg color:
1 (149, 190, 215)
7 (239, 239, 239)
```

* Output image

prime\_sage-git.png will be created.

![created image](https://github.com/sage-git/prime_image_maker/blob/master/img/prime_sage-git.png)

# Check

```
$ openssl prime 
 () is prime
```
